Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent place”
Reviews.Author: Spankytoes
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but not off par for other European hotels. Hardwood floors and decent enough bathroom. Very odd that you have to keep your room card in a slot to work the AC and heater. Breakfast is nice enough. Location is a few blocks from the Trevi Fountains and Spanish Steps. Entrance is in an alley way but we never felt unsafe. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: moretravel2Bhad
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for one night after our 8 day tour. We were welcomed by friendly helpful staff who looked after our luggage until it was time to check in. The room was really clean and fresh. There was a "working" safe. The bathroom was clean. We did not have a view out of the beautiful shuttered window but what we did have was the sounds of the back streets of Rome as this hotel is RIGHT in the heart of it. Breakfast was good with friendly helpful waiters. We could wander around all the little streets of Rome until late at night and feel safe and always close to our hotel. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a precious little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: M W
Reviews.Content: My 11-year-old daughter and I were backpacking around Italy and decided to treat ourselves in Rome. This was a tiny bit of luxury for us. The staff was friendly and efficient. Our room was just lovely. The bathroom, especially was beautiful. We had no view, but that didn't matter so much, since we just wanted to explore the city, anyway. The hotel is centrally located, so it was easy for us to walk to all we wanted to see. We would most certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colrah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2011 for 4 nights and cannot fault it in any way. We were warmly greeted by Tiziang who was very helpful with supplying us with any infomation we needed and checked us in very efficiently. The room was spacious and clean with a good powerful shower. The room had no view at all from the window and the TV only had 1 English channel (BBC World) but we weren't in Rome to sit looking out of our hotel window or watch TV. The hotel is in a perfect location, 5 mins walk to Trevi Fountain, 25 mins to Colloseum, 15 mins walk to Spanish Steps, 15 mins from the Pantheon, 2 mins walk to underground station (Barberini). Bascially, an excellent base for travellers like us who don't mind walking everywhere round a city. Importantly, the area felt safe and we had no hesitation walking round at night. There is a Spar shop round the corner which is perfect for any refreshments etc although don't expect award winning customer service from the staff. Breakfast is basic, bread, fruit, yogurts, scrambled egg and sausages etc but fine for us and the same standard we have experienced anywhere in Europe. We had an early morning trip one day and the hotel were good enough to allow us in 30 mins early to have breakfast. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again should I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good standard - walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: Randi L
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in this nice hotel in March 2012. The first night we got room no. 103 - claustrophobic with only a small window facing the backyard. Avoid this room if you can. We asked for another - and were lucky to get room 403 on the top floor - the hotel's only room with a balcony. Nice newly renovated rooms. Good breakfast. Good service. Central with walking distance to everything there is to see in the center of Rome. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Single Room 301 - BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: GasFromSomerset
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Hotel Memphis. I booked a single room, sometimes that means a double room with single occupancy. I had noticed a previous comment about the size of the single rooms but nothing could warn me how bad the room size is. On entering the room, I thought I had been booked into a cupboard, the width is less than 6 foot wide and about 10 foot long. This contained a single bed, a small table, a small wardrobe and a mini bar. On opening the shuttered window, I was faced by a wall about three foot away and the only light was from an opening at an angle of 90 degrees, you really had to peer out to see any scenery, it was just like out of Faulty Towers. I would assume that rooms 101, 201, 301 and 401 are all the same so I would avoid these at all costs. There must be single rooms with an outlook as someone has posted that their single room overlooked the street. The hotel and room have undergone a big refurbishment program but no amount of refurbishment can alter the size of a room. It would have been great for a child as it had a connecting door to a twin bedded room which was an acceptable size. It has digital TV, including Sky News. The air conditioning can be noisy but can be switched off overnight. The hand basin does not have a plug or stopper so the water cannot be contained, really odd. The hotel said it was just to wash your face!!!!! The hotel is in a side street where very little traffic traverses, so it is very quite and no noise from traffic or tourists. The breakfast was OK for a continental breakfast, the only hot item was scrambled eggs. The hotel staff were very helpful with providing information, ordering taxi's etc. The entrance area is compact but no real seating area. The old adage of you get what you pay for certainly applies here. For seven night’s bed and breakfast I paid £405, which £58 per night in the middle of Rome is cheap. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Pantheon and most tourist attractions. The local Barberrini Metro Station will take you to right outside the Colosseum and a short distance to the entrance to Saint Peters. If using a taxi from the railway station, ensure you have the address written down, as Rome taxi drivers do not have the KNOWLEDGE of British taxi drivers and they have never heard of this hotel. Taxi fares are very cheap as is the Metro system. Restaurants are plentiful in the area, as is an English pub the Albert just around the corner and a Spar shop opposite. To sum up, this hotel would be acceptable - 3 stars - provided you do not want a single room. If you want a single room I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay.”
Reviews.Author: jimger045
Reviews.Content: We spent five very pleasant days in Rome in mid-February including four nights in the Hotel Memphis and we were very happy with this choice. Its location is ideal for visiting all the major attractions in the centre of Rome – walking from the hotel, the Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona are all almost in a line .We walked this route so many times during those few days that it felt almost like home! We took a taxi from the airport, as we met two others who shared , – otherwise we would have taken the direct train to Termini Station. Must confess that the hotel didn't look terribly impressive when the taxi stopped and we could see it, just up a little cobbled street, but in fact it is a pretty cool little street, leading up to the piazza Barbereni and the Metro station just a few minutes away. The hotel is very modern and our room had everything we needed including a great shower, sat tv., etc. There is no bar or restaurant but in Rome you tend to leave your room early and , except for perhaps a quick visit to freshen up for the evening, return late at night, so maybe a lounge area , while it would be nice, is not much of an issue. The breakfast is excellent, by the way, and gives a great start to the day. Lots of restaurants nearby around the piazza Barbereni and Via Veneto and all the way to the Pantheon – spoiled for choice! We recommend a trip to Ostia Antica, the ancient port of Rome. Metro to Termini, then to Pyramide and a 20 minute or so train gets you there. In February, we had the place almost to ourselves and we marvelled at walking on paths where its 100,000 residents had trodden 2,000 years ago. Back in the city on another day we entered the Forum via the Palatine hill entrance. Snow still lay where the sun hadn't penetrated and we strolled along the pine strewn hill admiring the Domus Augustus and other ruins, eventually descending into the Forum itself - so magical! Had been there a few years ago and loved it and was not disappointed this time – how could you be! On another day we visited the Vatican – a one euro fare from our local metro. Went to the top of the cuppola – great for photos but quite a climb if, like my wife, you don't like heights!.Skipped the Vatican museum and Popes' tombs as we had seen them on our last trip. Instead we visited Castel Sant' Angelo – really worth a visit - and had a pleasant light lunch there as we looked across at the Vatican and handfed the almost tame pigeons that flew onto the castle window beside our table. Then we walked along the Tiber to Trastevere – quite a long walk – snack there and a visit to the Cathedral of S. Maria in Trastevere. The area is full of beautiful restaurants but it was too early for dinner – a pity! From there we strolled at leisure back to the hotel, following our map, passing the ruins at Largo di Torre Argentina called Area Sacra. Don't know much about it but the stray city cats sure loved it! Later, on a little street that leads up to the Pantheon, we stopped at a nice leather goods shop to buy gifts for our kids ( grown-up but still looking for presents! ) . Rome is a great city for walking – and has a surprise around every corner! And so much more to see – the Appian way, the Baths of Caracalla, the catacombs etc, etc, – still, we have to leave something for our next visit! Great trip, good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location ...”
Reviews.Author: ALJ89
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. Its within walking distance of the Travi fountain, spanish steps and via del corso (shopping streets). The hotel was very modern, very clean and we had a triple room with a double bed and a big sofa bed that was very comfortable. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom had a power shower that was really nice. The breakfast was lovely, you can have a continental breakfast. You could also have toast and cereal. with a choice of drinks from lattes to orange juice. The staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. Would recommend this hotel and would defiantly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kayley b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location, it is in the centre of Rome and is in the centre of tourist attractions. The hotel is very close to the Trevi Fountain and there are numerous shops/restaurants close by. We walked to most of the attractions, which were in easy walking distance. The hotel was very well presented, very modern and trendy inside. The rooms were comfortable; plenty of wardrobe space, air conditioning and comfy beds. The only issue was in the bathroom- the shower was very powerful and did not drain out of the shower tray fast enough.This often caused leaks and the bathroom floor was wet through. The tray would fill up within two minutes so showering became a problem. Breakfast was good- basic but good. I had an issue with the hotel, which I found very frustrating. Prior to arriving at the Memphis Hotel, I emailed them to enquire about the shuttle service that they provide, which will transport you from the airport to the hotel. I was informed that the cost of this journey would be 100 euros. I replied and stated that I did not require this service due to the excessive price. I received a reply stating that this was not a problem. However, when we landed at Ciampino airport the taxi driver from the hotel was waiting for us. I approached the driver to tell him that I did not want the shuttle and would be getting the bus to the hotel, which was four euros. The driver spoke very little English and could not understand us so he phoned the hotel and my partner spoke to the receptionist over the phone. They tried to argue that we had not notified them that we didn't want the shuttle. The receptionist said that she could reduce the price to 50euros.By this point though, we had already purchased bus tickets. I found the taxi driver and hotel receptionship to be very rude and unhelpful! Also, there is a three euro per person, per night city tax that every tourist is expected to pay on check-out from the hotel. We were not informed at point of booking or check-in and were lucky that we had just enough money left at check-out. Overall, a good stay and the hotel is beautiful and is in an amazing location. However, I felt that certain members of staff were very unhelpful and rude!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Vetgirl2004
Reviews.Content: Single rooms are small, but clean with modern bathroom. Air con (bit noisy but good to defrost after being out in the snow!), Sky TV. Breakfast simple but adequate. Staff very polite and helpful. Located well to see many sights on foot but close to Metro for those a little further afield. On quiet back street so good for nights sleep but difficult to find in heavy snow! Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Memphis”
Reviews.Author: Jorg A
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Hotel, excellent service, very nice staff, nice breakfast and very close to all the sites in Rome. We had a double room and could not fault it at all. Would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm”
Reviews.Author: 333Rae
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite well located at midway between the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain but this is about the best thing I can say for it. I stayed in a single room and it sounded as though the people next door were actually in the room with me. Absolutely no sound proofing at all. On top of this, the air conditioner was quite noisy and kept cutting in and out as it tried to regulate the temperature. This combination meant I had an appalling nights sleep....the worst by far of any the nights I spent in Europe during my holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Jana N
Reviews.Content: Took a while to find as it is down a small cobbled street but once I got there it was all worth it! Stayed in a single room that had everything I could ever want in a room. Very clean and neat, nice big window with a view of the street, desk, tv, amazing bathroom with towell warmers and soaps and shampoos. Just round the corner to the Trevi fountain and some fabulous restaurants and gelati!!!! Great shopping strip too. Breakfast wasn't included but wasn't too much to pay and was worth it anyway...yum! Service was fantastic. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip To Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ledgey
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome between 8th Dec - 11th Dec. We stayed at the Memphis, which is situated in a quiet side street in close walking distance to the main tourist sites. The staff were very friendly, especially the breakfast staff who were extremely polite and helpful. The rooms were well appointed, clean and of a good size for European hotels. This is listed as a 4 star but is really a good 3 by British standards. All in all if you wish to have a nice place to sleep and have breakfast then this hotel is an excellent starting point for any trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous City trip Rome”
Reviews.Author: SEAntwerp
Reviews.Content: 2 hour flight from brussels to Rome, where we where picked up by a driver from the Hotel. Smooth transfer (45 minutes) to the hotel. The hotel is a small hotel, very clean, but a little bit old fashioned and not realyvery "cosy". Small room, blank walls, but as stated earlier clean. Only realy minus is that they still use blankets to sleep, not so easy and comfortable. Very big plus is that the hotel is located in the middle of the old town center, everything is in walking distance. For a 4 day city trip this is OK. Breakfast is very basic, some croisants, sandwiches and cereals. OK, but not more than that. Rome itself, amazing! 4 days is even too short to see everything, we will need to go back. All in all, very nice trip, basic hotel, but it is Ok for the occasion

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return soon”
Reviews.Author: 124Mary66
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time in Rome and this hotel is a big part of the reason I will go back soon. Everything here was held to the highest of standards and gave me a trip of a lifetime. The room was unbelievably clean and the breakfast that was served started each of my days with a smile and burst of energy to explore the city. I can never say enough good things about the staff. I accidentally left a few pieces of jewelry in the room and while they were not monetarily very valuable they had tremendous sentimental value. As soon as I realized they were missing I called the hotel and they found them and shipped them to me. Doing this was above and beyond what I have experienced at other hotels. To be honest I was hoping they would say that they would hold them for me so I have an excuse to visit again. The Hotel Memphis is now my vacation home when I stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: allyssa_22
Reviews.Content: The worst customer service I have ever had. Our reservation request, that was made 2 weeks ago, had been completely ignored. We asked for a room for 2 with a bathtub, what we got was a room for 3 with a shower. When we asked to switch rooms, the lady at the desk told us the hotel was fully booked and did nothing. The room was freezing, and the bed was really uncomfortable. I've stayed in much nicer places, for much less. Then after about 2 hours, all the lights in our room randomly went out. When we called the lady at the desk, she came upstairs and fiddled with the light switches for 30 minutes clearly clueless, as we stood there asking her to call a technician. Fed up, we told her we didn't want to stay anymore, and she kept telling us the technician would come in 10 minutes. When we asked for a refund, she told us we'd have to come in the morning to talk to the manager because to her the problem had been fixed since she called a technician. Then she told us it was "impossible" for her to give us a refund and to her there is no problem because when she gave us the room, there was light. The technician took over 30 minutes to come and even then, the lights weren't fixed right away. We were in the lobby arguing with her for an hour, then she finally called her manager, who she didn't even let us speak to, then the manager told her to give us a refund. By the time we left, the lights in our room still hadn't been fixed. This was the first time I have ever left a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Clean Rooms, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: The location is good and the hotel is clean and modern, but the service was lacking. Two of the guys at the front desk were either inept and/or lazy, and definitely rude. One seemed completely put out when I asked him to call a restaurant to make a reservation for me. I already had the restaurant name and phone number; I just wanted him to call in case they didn't speak English. The midnight desk guy told us we had pay a certain charge in cash upon checking out because he was too lazy to swipe our credit cards, or maybe he wanted to take a cut of the cash. We refused and told him we paid the exact same charge at another hotel in Rome by credit card. It was only after we called him on his lie that he took our credit cards. Then we had another dispute over a cab to the airport, and to make a long story short, he accused me of lying. We stayed at Hotel Lancelot prior to the Hotel Memphis and there was a HUGE difference in the level of service. Outside of the service, we didn't have any complaints. The rooms were nice and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “check what facilities will be working/open when visiting”
Reviews.Author: Sharkies2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this property becuase the website showed that they had satellite television, a bar and restuarant and no mention of any of these facilities being seasonal. When we got to our room it was o.k until we turned on the t.v and the only channel we could get was CNN news! I went down to reception to tell them it was broken and the reeptionist said 'no it's not' very rudely. I advised that 'yes it is!' and asked they send someone up to look at it. No one came up that night so we watched the news over and over again (on a budget so could not afford to go out every night). The next day I asked again in the morning before the pointless continental breakfast (stale pastries and ceral boxes). Again I was told there is nothing wrong with it. After persisting again someone came up, looked at the wires, twiddled it, and left and once again said it was fine although clearly on the news channel available. great! We thought we could afford a couple of drinks in the bar in the hotel. on Asking reception where is was they said they do not have one, rudely of course. I showed them their brochure that clearly states a bar. She said it was the desk in the breakfast room that is closed. We had no t.v for 4 days other than the news, whichwe are now experts on, no bar for 4 days, rude staff every day and poor housekeeping. Room was not hoovered in 4 days and had to ask for clean towels. Luckily, all the excursions we did were very good so only had to spend evenings in room with nothing to watch! This is not a 4 star hotel I would say 2.5 star and thats being nice! If you are on a budget and just going with a friend I would recommend booking one of the many other hotels that may be only £20.00 more and get treated with respect and have the basic services it advertises. Air conditioning was rubbish and very loud and did not cool the room even in March!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Debra O
Reviews.Content: When we entered the narrow street we thought what had we come to but werepleasantly surprised by the interior of the hotel. We arrived before midday but our rooms were ready for us to check in. Both rooms were at the front onthe first and second floor,they were very spacious and bathrooms very well equipped. One room had a problem with the tv and the man on reception could not have been more helpful and sorted out. We found all staff polite and helpful. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “1st stop. Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop in Italy. Hotel Memphis was going to be our home for the next 4 days. After being dropped off by the taxi on a tight cobblestone walkway, our first impression was not a good one. My sister in law muttered "omg. Did i make a bad choice? It said 4 stars online." Little did she know, she made a great choice! Room were a little bit cramped but the hotel makes up for it by it's service and overall feel. Location was great! Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Trajan's Column, Colosseum, Via Veneto etc were close proximity of the hotel. Of course, the metro subway station is only 2-3 minutes away. The supermarket Despar is just around the corner if you need water, I personally liked the Despar on Via Del Tritone as they had the bigger 2 litre bottles for 20-30 cent euro. It's a 10 minute walk but my gosh, you're just absorbing the city's inner beauty. Staff were great! They were very helpful and accomodating. My brother in law had a crush on the hotel receptionist. She's quite pretty. Daily breakfast buffets were included. Fresh scrambled eggs, hot dog, coffee, milk, cereal, hard boiled eggs, etc. Very good to start your day. I would highly recommend this hotel. Next time I'm back in Rome. I will still stay at the same hotel. Rome was my favorite location throughout the trip. It was due to the hotel & it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the small details”
Reviews.Author: LeonieshorncliffeQLD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little disappointing. It is in a great location but lacked the small details. The window had dark shutters so it felt like night time no matter what time it was. The bed covers were very unattractive and old fashioned, the hair dryer did not have the power to actually dry my hair, the make up mirror was placed for giants, there was no body lotion provided. It was certainly not the kind of room you would want to spend any time in, however it was very clean and the bathroom, while tiny was very good. Breakfast was standard and the reception staff were cold and I felt like a nuisance asking questions. I would stay here again but only if nothing else was available.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - tripadvisor led me astray!”
Reviews.Author: Z-Canadian-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome for 3 nights during the first week of September and stayed at the Memphis. This was by far the worst hotel we stayed at in Italy and for the price we paid, I definitely don't recommend it for the following reasons: - Hotel room was tiny even by European standards and I had a very clausterphobis feeling the whole time we stayed there. The shower is so tiny that if i was so stretch both elbows out I would hit the walls (and I'm petite). - The hot water in the sink takes a good 2-5 minutes to warm up and the shower hot water takes about 2 minutes to heat up. I felt so wasteful turning the tap on to heat up before use. - The hotel walls are very thin. We could hear everything happening on the same floor and outside. When you have spent the whole day walking you value a good night sleep and I kept waking up at night because of all the noise from outside. - The hotel staff was rude, disengaged, and very uninformative (except the waiter in the breakfast room). When I asked for a recommendation of where we should eat lunch the lady at the front replied "anywhere"! - The tv/satellite signal kept cutting out on a hot summer day (not a big deal but annoying) Positives: - Great location - close to most attractions - The waiter in the breakfast room was very welcoming and very accommodating Overall, I would never stay at this hotel again and I would never recommend it. I would give it 3 stars at best by European standards and 2 stars by NA standards.

Reviews.Title: “'When in Rome'.... stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Zara_2011
Reviews.Content: I brought my other half here for his birthday and we absolutely loved it. It's a real gem, close to everything, modern... lovely. The rooms aren't amazing but the bathroom actually makes it - a massive and really lovely waterfall shower. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “4 glorious nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dessie1812
Reviews.Content: Our guide booked us into this hotel and we had no expectations. From the moment we checked-in to our room, I knew we had stumbled onto something great especially after our first 'walk around' the evening we got in. 5 minutes leisurely stroll to the Trevi Fountain, another 2 minutes to Piazza Barberini and the start of Via Veneto, 15 minutes to the Piazza Spagna. What else could one ask for? Well, how about three great restaurants within walking distance - Pisciapiano Guioia Mio right NEXT to the hotel, Colline Emiliane about 50 paces up the alley (it's in the Michelin Guide) and Hostaria Romano just 2 minutes' walk away. The hotel staff are truly hospitable and helpful, rooms (only 20 of them) are reasonably spacious and extremely comfortable (we had a double bed AND an extra sofa bed). Cable TV, Internet (NOT free) and a nice breakfast room. The Memphis is only 2 years old and part of the Remar Hotels chain. We had stayed in its sister Hotel Pierre in Florence earlier on this trip and were also blown away. More on that later.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: From the street, we thought, "Oh great, what did we just sign up for!" This place is an actual oasis with brilliantly remodeled rooms and modern amenities. It is worth every penny! The staff was helpful and amazing and even offered us a free breakfast when we showed up hours before check-in time, which we really appreciated! Location is awesome too! Take is from this New Yorker who doesn't dish out compliments that often. Stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, and at a good location (walking)”
Reviews.Author: Arikiis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at this hotel, to celebrate my birthday in Rome. We found the hotel very pleasant, clean and friendly. It is also nicely situated to give you a lot of the city's attraction within walking distance (but bear in mind we like to walk a lot, and 20-30 minutes is NOT a long distance for us); Fontana di Travis is within 5 minutes, and so is the bus station of most 'hop-on/hop-off' lines ("city tour"). The rooms were nice and comfortable. Our room had also a little balcony which made it even nicer. The bathroom was modern, very nicely arranged, and was very clean. The staff was friendly, even if not everyone speaks fluent English. Breakfast was included; it was a little less than what I expect at breakfast, but you can still have a reasonable one (above a continental breakfast).. I am not sure what we paid for the hotel, as it was part of a deal with the flights, but it seems a little high for 4-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mandie73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night before going on a cruise. We arrived early so was expecting to have to leave our cases with reception so we could go out exploring!! As our room was ready they let us check in at 10:40 which was fantastic. The staff were very friendly and helped us to see as much as possible in 36 hours. The hotel was very clean and modern! It was in a perfect location, not far from any of the main points of interest. This hotel is very good value for money with bed and breakfast, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Stallion88
Reviews.Content: Hotel Memphis offers an excellently run hotel considering it size. All the staff are friendly and always willing to help if you're in need of any assistance. The rooms are of a high quality especially the bathroom. They might be on the small side but with all the sight seeing to do in Rome you won't be in it all day. The rooms having sky in them was a very nice touch, a great way to finish a day off. Breakfast was of a continental style, no complaints there, the food was excellent and the staff were great too. Overall a great hotel and me and my wife would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL THANKS TO IT'S LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: pg0909_10
Reviews.Content: HOTEL MEMPHIS is very good hotelI in terms of value for money and it's of it's central location. The breakfast room is very small and crowded most of the times.If you are travelling solo and booked a single room i have to say the rooms are very small and dark(The windows don't open)

Reviews.Title: “central location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Lewington
Reviews.Content: Strategically placed for all the centre attractions particularly the Trevi Fountains. Smiling and helpful welcome. Room was small and the third bed was a made up sofa bed, but perfectly adequate for a short stay. Well equipped and tidy, the view wasn't great but what would you expect from a hotel in the centre of a historic area of a capital city. Windows with shutters ensured a good nights sleep even though our room overlooked the street. Breakfast was uninspiring but more than enough to set you up for a days exploring. We had a late flight home and the hotel was more than happy to secure our luggage for the day following our stay. Altogether a pleasurable stay with friendly helpful staff in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HKTHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for one night in Rome based on received feedback and can recommend it as long as you are not looking for luxury or services that a big hotel may offer. Positive: Location and clean rooms; negative: thin walls and small room (it turned out that we had the smallest double room of the floor). The staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: StulynSheffield
Reviews.Content: Having read some negative review for this Hotel, have decided the writer has not stayed here or expect too much from a city centre hotel. The poition of the Hotel made it an ideal base in which to tour Rome. Easy access to all transport links and many historic sites within easy walking distance. The room's whilst not large were clean and more than adequate for our needs. Any bathroom shower that can cope with my 6'7" husband is welcome. Staff helpful in all area's and it was great to be offered hot food at breakfast without being charged extra as our friends were in a so called 5 star Hotel near by. Fabritzio who served us for breakfast each morning was so helpful and gave us good tips on how to travel around his city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience During 7 Country Trip”
Reviews.Author: ldarnell
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed incredible service from the hotel's management and staff. They made us feel exceptionally welcome and part of their family. The manager in particular was an obvious professional and dedicated to world class customer service. Breakfast every morning was a positive experience and got us off to a great day. The dining room was presented as a four star restaurant with a great selection of food. The dining attendant was also servcie oriented, a world traveler and great conversationalist. He commented his greatest job satisfaction came from interacting with hotel guests. The entire hotel was spotlessly clean and the location was unbeatable. Within five to ten minute walks, we easily found the Trevi Fountains, Spanish Steps, Metro Stop and main train station. An example of the management's incredible customer service was that my wife left some new shoes bought in Rome that she absolutely loved. In Venice, she noticed she had left them at Hotel Memphis and sent an email hoping they were found. To my great surprise, within 24 hours, she received a reply and was informed they had been mailed to our home without charge. If you need anything special, be sure to ask for the manager because he will do anything possible to meet your needs. We would undoubltedly stay at the Hotel Memphis upon our return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, humiliating experience”
Reviews.Author: cserme
Reviews.Content: I have to start with the fact that I never stayed at this hotel (thank God), just walked in for some information. It was my birthday and was looking for a restaurant suggested to me by someone I asked on the street. It was closed at that time as it was 6pm but I saw this hotel directly next to it and thought it would be a good idea to ask for some information from the staff. It turned out to be a horrible idea in the end.... As soon as I entered, I found a lady and a gentleman behind the reception desk chatting. They never bothered standing up even when I approached the desk. As soon as I mentioned the name of the restaurant they looked at each other with this sarcastic look on their faces and started giggling. It was very embarassing to me. When I asked if they had a menu for the restaurant (as they are next to each other maybe they have some agreement with them to send over some guests), the answer of the gentleman was this: "No, that is a restaurant, this is a hotel." I didn't want to give up just yet so I asked them if they could check the menu for me on internet (I don't believe this is a strange request from the staff of a 4-star hotel. ). The answer from the same person was the following: "No, we don't have computers for other people!" Well, as for "other people", they made me feel like an alien, indeed.... At this point I just thanked them, turned around and started walking out hoping this joke would be over...I was very wrong. As I was leaving the desk I heard the man say a very insulting swear word to his colleague. I understand Italian as I've been living here for quite some time now. I didn't want to turn around and respond because I don't like to make scenes, however as soon as I had the chance (2 days later) I did send an email to the General Manager of the hotel, still haven't received any response. I don't want to let this go without any consequences because I believe it is outrageous that staff members of a hotel of this category allow themselves this attitude and behaviour. I would like to underline again that I haven't stayed at this hotel, this is not a review about the property itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern, no real charm though”
Reviews.Author: nomore3X5's
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the rooms were modern and well laid out and the location was amazing. The hotel did not have very much charm however and that warm service was not always present. No wifi in rome was not very good! - Laundromat on same street as hotel has highspeed internet - very handy. The breakfast was ok but the breakfast room is way too bright and the atmosphere is not pleasant. I would probably try something else next time I am in rome although not bad if you are running out of options.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Watkins-party-of-two
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, really close to all key areas of Rome. Rooms are small but no different to that of other old European hotels. Rooms very clean, breakfasts are basics. There's a small bar near by and lovely restaurants near by. Definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean and handy location”
Reviews.Author: TazzaT
Reviews.Content: I found myself with a spare night due to a glitch in my itinerary, my doing, I was due to stay at Hotel Alexandra but as it was the weekend of the Beatification of the Pope - the rates went up 200%. So, thanks to Trip Advisor I found this hotel closeby, and I discovered it's in a great location. The staff were fine, the maids adorable, speaking with me in my not-quite-perfect italiano. The room was spacious, nicely renovated bathroom, fabulous shower, very clean and I slept well, and although others had found it noisy, I didn't. Friends arrived early the next morning so I didn't stay for breakfast. I'd probably stay again, due to location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location..but the bedroom was small and dark”
Reviews.Author: Peter_and_Sheila
Reviews.Content: Many other reviewers have remarked upon the great location, attentive staff and recent modern refurbishment of the hotel. Our downsides were a small dark bedroom, toilet flushing noises, doors slamming, early morning street noise from the alley at the front of the hotel and a slightly limited breakfast choice. The 4 stars rating is only just about justified. However, we were here to see Rome and the hotel's location in the centre of the city more than made up for its shortcomings. Everywhere, except the Vatican City, was in walkable distance and a great choice of cafes and restaurants were on the doorstep. The hotel wasn't cheap but based upon Rome prices in general made for reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MitsyManchester
Reviews.Content: Came back yesterday from Rome where we had stayed at the Memphis Hotel. On arrival, I did wonder about the little cobbled back street it was on but it is at the end towards a busy area so I felt no safety issues. I would echo almost exactly the previous two reviews. Our room was smallish but with a big comfortable bed with spotless linen. We heard no noise in the hotel either from outside or inside. The bathroom was very stylish but small, A good powerful shower but not room for two of you in there!! The staff were pleasent and helpful when approached. The dining room is small but sunny and light. Not a huge choice but enough. One review said there was only tinned fruit. Yes there was but also fresh fruit was available too. We also walked to the Vatican (and everywhere else in Rome it seemed to me!) but walking brings surprises around every corner. Yes Rome is expensive, but so are all cities I suppose. Very well located. Definitely would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Maconda4th
Reviews.Content: Three nights at the Memphis.We were a family party of five using two rooms. The hotel is situated in a narrow cobbled street about 400 metres from the Trevi Fountain. This is a small smartly styled hotel.The staff are quietly proffessional and were always willing to help. The rooms are small but equipped with a televison and a well stocked fridge.A kettle and some beverage making sachets would have made it even better for me.The bathrooms are beautifully styled extremely clean and have some extras,shoe shine,shower cap,soap and shampoo. tissues etc. No bath, but very good powerfull showers.Our stay was a sightseeing break and with two teeagers and a younger child we found that the hotel was placed ideally for the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Pantheon and the Colleseum.We also walked to St Peters Square which took about 45 mins. Breakfast is continental.-Bacon and eggs -forget it -It's Rome not Bogner Regis.The breakfast manager worked very hard to please all very curtious and helpfull. We would definately stay again.Eating..out. Food and drink in Rome is very very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again, even though it wasn't expensive.”
Reviews.Author: newyorker021
Reviews.Content: 1. They call themselves a 4 star hotel but it is not. It is essentially a bed & breakfast with a decent elevator. 2. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms renovated, but the walls were paper thin--you could hear everything all night, which kept us up. 3. Our room faced an alley and was very dark and dingy. 4. The breakfast was just ok--canned fruit but decent croissants & good espresso. 5. The front desk was not pleasant or helpful. 6. The location overall was centrally located but the setting of the hotel was unfortunate; it was on a dark narrow street. 7. The hotel was much smaller than the pictures indicate, with little to no lobby to speak of. 8. There was no duvet on the bed--just sheets and a bedspread--we had to go into the closet to get a blanket and the blanket wasn't great. 9. We booked on hotels.com and this hotel got really good reviews, which surprised us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: G_M_NGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, and ours lacked natural light. But rooms at the back are very quiet, and we slept very well. The hotel has been refurbished to a high standard, and is immaculately maintained. Bathrooms are well equipped (great shower, hair dryer, toiletries etc) and towels and bedlinen changed every day. Breakfast was OK - the usual city hotel fare but a bit meagre. Coffee was good, though. The location is great, central for many of the main attractions but not on a main road. Best of all, next door is a fantastic Trattoria with reasonably-priced delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Just about adequate for 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: matsilojo
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not have a lounge or bar just a small foyer with some lounge chairs near the reception desk. We found the staff to be polite and helpful. The breakfast room is very small and the continental breakfast was very basic, cheese and meat slices, two choices of cereal, two choices of bread, a few cakes, plain and fruit yoghurts and a plate of scrambled egg left uncovered on the side, mixed fruit salad and fresh fruit etc. nothing to write home about! Our bedroom, only just large enough, had a king sized bed with firm mattress but our friends room was smaller with only room for one to pass the end of the bed with no desk space or chair. The rooms were cleaned and tidied well each day. Shower room was good but hand towels were like large white tea towels, bath towels were good. Would first look elsewhere in the same area if we travel to Rome again as it was well situated. Definately not four star. Would recommend with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY RUDE Manager and staff--would never return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wandering77Friend
Reviews.Content: In summary, this hotel's manager and staff treated me as if I was gum stuck to the sidewalk. When there was a glitch with our reservation, they refused to assist me and did not allow me to even use my friend's room to figure out a new plan. No matter what, I would rather sleep in Termini than give my business to this hotel. No amount of negotiating with the manager was acceptable. The hotel has tiny rooms that are way overpriced. I ended up in another more welcoming establishment near Repubblica.

Reviews.Title: “Can't give proper review since they GAVE AWAY our room!”
Reviews.Author: FleaBag08
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over a month in advance thru Expedia. We arrived in Rome and after an expensive taxi ride arrived at the hotel at 8 pm. After we gave our name and reservation information to the front desk and we were told, "Oh I'm sorry your hotel is down the street 50 kilometers." We were confused seeing as that we booked a room at Hotel Memphis. The gentleman at the desk vaguely said "The hotel had a problem today, so we are fully booked...your reservation has been moved down the street". The hotel refused to even arrange a taxi to take us there to check out the accommodations, since there was considerable hassle lugging our luggage thru the cobblestones; saying a taxi wouldn't drive such a short distance. We were open to the move until we checked the trip advisor rating of our new hotel---Hotel Angelo Americano---which had a 71% negative rating!! Last Hotel Angelo customer was also moved there because of a "mistake" from another hotel. We would have LOVED to call to confirm with the hotel, regardless of Expedia's guarantee, since we were arriving so late, but I was NOT able to find a telephone number for the hotel anywhere on their site or google maps. Check. BEWARE---NOT WORTH YOUR PEACE OF MIND ON A HOLIDAY OR VACATION!

Reviews.Title: “Just scraping into 4 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: Grant_UK
Reviews.Content: First the plus points - the staff are really nice, the rooms are clean and the bathrooms look gorgeous and a quite good location. The main negatives would be a) a tiny room that would have been fine for 1 but it's sold as a double and I don't like have to walk sideways round the bed to get out, bending myself almost double in the process to avoid the wall mounted tv... and b) we had a room on the first floor at the front - very noisy, plus the walls are thin so we could hear our neighbours on the phone and they weren't even talking loudly. You need earplugs! Breakfast was the most barren out of any hotel I have stayed in Italy. It's very nice, there just isn't a lot of it - so if you are hungry then it puts you off going back for a second helping. Again the service is lovely, but I did feel like it was a bit of a shock if I asked for a second coffee. Location is quite good - a few minutes walk from a metro and about 5 minutes maximum from the Trevvi Fountain, it's a shame it's not the other side of the Trevvi Fountain but that's not their fault. There is a supermarket within about a 3 minute walk. This is the only hotel I have stayed in in Italy (I think maybe the 5th one in total) where I have been charged a city tax upon checkout that wasn't quoted in the price upfront. It's currently 6 euros a night. Maybe all Rome hotels do this now, I don't know. I liked the hotel for the staff and possibly the location, if it hadn't been for those two things it would have scored lower. Finally there is meant to be free wi fi in reception but I couldn't get it to work so I will be putting a "no" next to that when you ask me further down in this review

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated but no free wifi and no wifi in rooms !!!”
Reviews.Author: LesTropeziennes
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on expedia for two nights for business travel. - Very well situated, right in the center of Rome in a cute typical roman street : 5 minutes from fontana di trevi, 10 minutes from via del corso (shopping street), and piazza di spagna, piazza del popolo, Villa Borghese. a few minutes away from Metro Barberini (linea A) (at the end of the hotel's street). Only problem : if you have a car, the streets in the center are closed from 6 AM to 6 PM. Except taxi. - I booked a single room, they put me in room 201 (see picture), it looked like a narrow corridor with a small window with no view (the view was a "wall corner") and a tiny cupboard. The bathroom had more air to breathe than the bedroom. They use this room when they need to add a third person supplement to the double room next door, I guess. After a while i finally managed to change room to the 4th floor, which was much better. Wasn't really easy though ! i had to explain that I was claustrophobic so they understand the problem ! NO WIFI in the rooms and NOT FREE : 5€ for one hour and 10€ for 3hours Quite expensive when you see that every hotel offers free wifi ! The WIFI is only available in the reception area, and in rooms they give you a ETHERNET cable to use, I had to change mine 4 times and still didn't work.... I was only told at the end of my stay that there were two ETHERNET plugs. So if you are a business traveller who has to work in peace try to find another hotel, unless they change their internet offer/connexion. - Staff is very nice (Danilo and Eleonora) always available and helpfull (I had a lot of problems with the internet in my room during my whole stay, they helped me until the end! Danilo in particular who was offering me coffee while he tried to arrange the problem in the reception). - Breakfast was correct and simple : different types of croissants, fresh slices of bread, little salted "brioches", marmelade, fruit, eggs, but orange juice and ananas juice aren't fresh. The people serving tea/coffee are very nice too. Restaurants in the area are only for "tourists" where you don't eat very well (considering that Roman cuisine is one of the best in Italy! it's a shame not to taste it), i do not recommend them at all. The hotel will tell you to go to "Wine and Grill" - but when I saw the state of the raw fish and meat in the entrance I escaped ! After a 40 min walk one night, I finally found a lovely Roman restaurant very close to Fontana di Trevi : SPIRITI E FORME Vicolo scavolino n°63. They offer a great choice of wine, staff is very professional, I had a very nice "carpaccio di zucchini con Pesto di rucola e pine e parmeggiano" + Pici (sort of fresh spaghettis) Cacio e Pepe (typical roman pasta sauce with pecorino cheese and black pepper, delicious!) Not very expensive (10€ for a primo compared to 15-20€ in the tourist restaurants without the same quality). Good global impression a part from internet connexion.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysReady2Go
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay with wife and friends. Got a good deal online though a little worried by look of exterior of hotel on arrival - no need to worry though as it's been renovated and is now in very good condition indeed. A short walk from both the Trevi Fountain and Barberini Metro, the hotel is ideally placed for getting around the city and seeing the sights. Rooms, though small, were in excellent condition. Bathrooms are new and the shower pressure superb. Limited English channels on TV (news and music) and no tea/coffee making facilities - though in-room mini bar wasn't too expensive. Plenty of eateries within a short walk - some more expensive than others - €4.50 for a small coffee a little steep. Rome is a city made for walking - and this hotel is ideally placed. Don't let the exterior put you off - it's much much better inside and there are only 20 rooms so it never feels too big or impersonal. Included breakfast was excellent. However there is a charge for wifi which is a bit of a shame. Pros: Location, cleanliness, size, price, friendly staff Cons: No free wifi, no tea making facility in room, no lounge/bar area. Would we stay again? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jonny_c67
Reviews.Content: Right, to start off I would like to say that the previous bad reviews are not valid any more as the hotel was obviously really bad a few years ago but has recently undergone a very good renovation. European hotels are generally nothing compared to hotels in America or the Middle East (unless you are talking about the Ritz), but I have to say that for a European hotel this is the nicest one I have ever stayed in. It has been done up very nicely; the decoration is modern, rooms are spotless, bathroom and shower are amazing, nothing negative I can say about the hotel itself. The only downside to this hotel was the staff. Apart from a young girl who was at reception the first night we arrived and the man serving breakfast, the rest were not at all helpful, and made you feel as if they were discussing you in Italian while you were standing right in front of them. Do not let this put you off however. We found the majority of people in Italy to be extremely rude and arrogant. They all seem to have this 'we don't need you' attitude with tourists. We always made an effort to try and speak Italian to people but as I said, did not seem impressed and acted as if we were causing them an inconvenience just by breathing! So do not let this put you off about this hotel, or any hotel in Rome, for as far I am concerned, most people in Rome are rude. Breakfast was normal for a European hotel. Ham, cheese, salami, croissants, bread, jam, yoghurt, boiled eggs and a few types of cereal. All in all I would recommend this hotel and would most probably go back unless I win the lottery and stay at a 5 star deluxe hotel next time! Rooms are excellent, location is amazing (you cross the road and come to the little alleyways that lead to the Trevi fountain, plus Barberini metro is 2 minutes away), breakfast is normal. Contributed towards a wonderful 3 days in Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Memphis, was a dream!”
Reviews.Author: laughincloud
Reviews.Content: As you can see from the previous reviews, they are rather dated. My husband and I had a delightful time. Yes the rooms are a little small. But who goes to Rome to stay all day in the Hotel? The room was perfect for us. Recently renovated, and immaculately clean. Large bed, at first I thought a little hard. But never did we wake up, complaining of a sore back, and once slept in till 10am which is totally out of character for both of us. The sheets and towels were changed daily, and the room cleaned to an impeccably high standard Sky TV, was useful for weather, and keeping in touch with the News. Now for the location. We were a five minute walk, from the Trevis Fountain. The same for the Spanish steps, and about eight minutes to the Pantheon. Ancient Rome was a good stretch of the legs, I would say a good half an hour to forty minutes. Not that you notice because Rome is beautiful. About the same for the Vatican. Also let me add, that next door to the Memphis, is a small family run restaurant which was voted best restaurant in Rome, for 2010. I can highly recommend it, the atmosphere in there was unforgettable.. The breakfast was continental buffet style, with as much coffee and tea you can drink. The Staff were fabulous, friendly, warm, highly efficient. Don't let the previous reviews put you off. Because, everything changes and nothing stays the same, and thankfully for the Memphis, this was for the better. If you need any more comments, go onto the expedia website they, are also more up to date...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but old hotel and decadent and very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Blues_Travelller
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel with my family last year. The room is very small. It barely fits the bed and the TV. The mattress is probably there since its opening. You could see the “U” format of all bodies that rested in that bed. The bathroom was clean, but very small and there was no curtains to separate the shower box (the smaller I’ve seen) from the rest for the room. Also, the towels were ridiculous. They were made from the same material as the bed linen. Breakfast was ok, if wasn’t for the rudeness of the staff. Apart from that, the location is great. It is near Trevy’s Fountain and not fair from the tubes and Coliseum. All that said, I think it is not worthy the price we paid (almost US$ 250). It is a huge rip off for what the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Tired Hotel bad breakfast - 2* at most”
Reviews.Author: dBoxxer
Reviews.Content: As mentioned this hotel is in dire need of a refurbishment. It was clean-ish but there are marks all over the walls and the rooms are old and mine was small. My TV remote control was bigger than the TV (nearly). My room could have been in a nuns convent. The lobby has masking tape covering wires that have been painted over. I know it's Italy but I still a rate a good hotel by the breakfast. The fruit available was old and bruised all over. I went for a boiled egg and it was all black inside - god knows how long it had been there. So just coffee and bread - not a 4 star breakfast. I know value for monery can be a problem in Rome but this fell way short of good value. I would try another hotel. Rome is not that big!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice...”
Reviews.Author: tennisgal33
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their own web site. It was listed as a 4-star hotel. NOT EVEN CLOSE! The room was small and run-down, as a matter of fact the whole hotel was run down. There was a small window in the room which overlooked the exhaust system of the restaurant next door. There were hairs in the sink, on the floor and in the shower of the bathroom and the a/c did not work. We spent a completely miserable first night in that room because it was so hot. We talked to the staff in the morning and they agreed to move us and really didn't seem surprised when we told then the a/c was not working. The 2nd room also had the exhaust system view; The staff told us the rooms with windows to the street were noisy. This room was a little cooler but we had no hot water when we showered. The only 2 redeeming qualities for the Memphis are the location near the Trevi and the staff was extremely nice. Unfortunately, it was just not enough to justify $250 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, needs 100% met”
Reviews.Author: Galilean
Reviews.Content: Booked on easyhotels. Took my Mom for a short getaway. Sure, if you want to pay a fortune for a street view, go ahead. However, ifyou want a clean place, at a decent price, with nice staff, this works. Very walkable...and, near the northern parts of Rome, where you can get away from all the tacky touristy crowds. Nearby restaurants, Spanish Steps, Trevi Foutnain, metro. The sheets are IRONED, if that tells you anything... The morning breakfast was lovely, VERY big selection and no rushing. But alas, if you just have to have a dulcit corporate logo-ridden hotel chain...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JosieJelly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in what looks like a back street but the location is wonderful - 3 mins to the Trevi Fountain, 5 mins to the Pantheon and all the lovely little streets to explore. We booked through Easyjet and got a good deal (3 nights for 2), but I must admit I had a look on this site and wasnt impressed by the comments. However the hotel was great, breakfast was good and the rooms were very comfortable - just what the doctor ordered after a long day sightseeing. I would recommend the Hotel for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: liverpoolladies
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel this week, for three nights. It is a small hotel based centrally for the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps. We arrived early and the room was ready. The room itself was small but quite adequate for our needs, tea and coffee making facilites in the room, would have been appreciated, however there was a minibar. The room was cleaned on a daily basis, however the dusting did not include the head of the bed on which there was a thick coat of dust. The weather was cold but the room was heated and very warm. Breakfast was included again adequate and three hours in which to eat it from 7-10am. From a tourist point of view the hotel was ideally situated, within walking distance of the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps. All the staff me met were helpful and friendly except for one of the reception staff who tried to get us to hire a private care for the return journey to the airport for 20 Euro's more than the Taxi price. In the end the taxi did not turn up and we only just made it to the terravision bus and the airport on time, next time would get the bus to the airport and avoid the anxiety of waiting for taxi's... Apparrently the taxi's do not like to travel to Ciampino airport in the morning as they can not always get a fare back to the City.. Would we stay there again, yes the price for three nights with breakfast was acceptable and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “4 star - not likely - more like -1*.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night break in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Memphis. It is advertised as a 4 star hotel and so we expected good standard which was certainly lacking. The rooms are small and dark with bathrooms which would not be out of place in a YMCA. There weren't even proper towels provided when we arrived!! The breakfast served in what is laughingly called a dining room is nothing short of poor, stewed coffee, a few bread rolls, some boiled eggs and some salami type meat which looked none too fresh. When we asked for cold milk this was brought to our table in the carton!!! If you are looking for a nice hotel in Rome don't stay here. BACKPACKING STANDARD BUT NOT BACKPACKERS PRICES.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A place of contrasts but doesn't that apply to Italy, if not Rome itself. Great location - Trevi, Spanish Steps and don't forget Via Vento. Handy for the Metro, bus routes and numerous eating places from cheap pizzerias through interesting trattorias - and that's not to mention the ice cream! The price of being away from a main road is the cobbled alley that leads passed the hotel. Inside, the facilities are limited and (especially the plumbing) in need of updating. Rooms are average - some beds ok and others, apparently, not so good. The odd loose shelf and poor sound-proofing were balanced by a convenient electronic personal safe. Breakfast was poor by European standards but the real sting came at checkout. The receptionist lied about the Mastercard slip showing the conversion from Euros (that I had booked on-line) to British pounds, stating that I was signing for the Euro amount! There was no option but to sign at an exorbitant rate of 1 EUR = 0.700 GBP. Few less coins for the fountain...

Reviews.Title: “Surprised Given the Reviews I had Read”
Reviews.Author: Sorcha99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel memphis for four nights recently and i was quite happily surprised given what i had read on Trip Advisor and other websites. The hotel is perfectly located beside the Barberini Plaza and about a three minute walk from the Trevi Fountain. The staff were always pleasant and helpful and they also arranged for a car to collect us from the airport. The room was bigger than i had expected and our large patio windows opened into a beautiful balcony, complete with table and chairs. Breakfast consisted of rolls and cold meats and cheeses. Very typical of other Italian hotels. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a convenient, comfortbale and good value hotel for their trip in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Trevi, but that's the only good point”
Reviews.Author: AJO_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a dirty back alley not far from the Trevi fountain (a poor location compared to other streets in the vicinity). We found the staff to be pleasant and the foyer well furnished. The room, however, was dank and dark with no outlook whatsoever. The air conditioning was poor and was not able to control the room temperature. The breakfast was minimal and not of a good quality. I will never repeat the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dqtoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Hotel Memphis, on Avignonese in Rome. Just two blocks from the Trevi Fountain, a block from the Metro station, and within walking distance of a lot of attractions, shopping and restaurants. Helpful staff and nice rooms. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Granhaug
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel Memphis, Rome in March 2005. As I was traveling with a small group, it became very clear that the room in this small hotel where quite varied, some small with a balcony others larger without. My room faced the alley in front of the hotel, which made it difficult to sleep with the windows open as there was a bit noisy all night. And as the hotel turns off the air condition outside the warmest season, this was a bit of a problem. But other rooms faced away from the alley, and did not have this noise problem. But overall, the hotel was nice and with a location that is difficult to beat. Within walking distance to most tourist sites, and right by the Barbareni metro. Good breakfast and clean rooms. Recommended for tourists

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rome_at_Easter
Reviews.Content: Hi We got back from Rome yesterday. We had 3 nights - two full days and did a lot without being too much. We did Trevi fountain, Colloseum & Forum, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, St Peters Basilica , Trastevere but unfortunately not Pantheon or Sistine Chapel as they were closed. Easter is a very busy time to visit Rome and the sights were very congested - you will be fine in May but they are still popular with the crowds. No problems with pickpockets you just have to be sensible. Gelati is wonderful as are the pasta and pizzas! We walked everywhere - it is the best way as then you don't miss a thing. Have a wonderful time and Ciao Bella as they say in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilbo1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Memphis, Rome in February 2005. This is a pleasant small hotel situated in a small lane close to the Trevi Fountain and very central for virtually every Rome tourist attraction. Our room was perhaps smaller than average (but possibly typical for Rome). Nevertheless, it was very clean and comfortable, with air conditioning, clean sheets every day, and a balcony (although no views from the balcony). We found the hotel welcoming and the staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfast provided was good with a reasonable selection of food and drinks. Don't be put off by the pokey lane the hotel is in as this ensures that the location is actually much quieter than many in Rome. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Memphis to anyone who is seeking a comfortable and quiet 3/4 star hotel in a central Rome location.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Memphis
HotelInfo.Address: Via Degli Avignonesi 36/a, 00187 Rome, Italy
